str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Even as, just as. From katha and per; exactly as.
And he, she, it, and that. From kai and ekeinos; likewise that.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To mix with, unite. From sun and kerannumi; to commingle, i.e. to combine or assimilate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
